page.title: 25Transport
page.content:
In 1993, passenger trains returned to Hucknall, with the opening of the Robin Hood Line from Nottingham to Mansfield Woodhouse. In 2004, Nottingham Express Transit trams began running from Hucknall to Nottingham rail station. The A611 now by-passes Hucknall Town Centre, but there is continuing debate about an Inner Relief Road with a partial closure of the High Street. The Trent Barton garage in Hucknall closed in 2011, and bus routes have been changed in the light of competition from NET trams. National Cycle Route 6 passes through Hucknall, and several roads in the town have a cycle lane.
David Heathcote
